alert.note: Alert for Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 17 at 7:56PM CDT until March 23 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing. * WHEN...Until Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Nel-Wyn Park at Tunica Lake begins to flood. The entrance road to Tunica River Park is flooded. Camp lots south of Flower Lake are flooding, along with an extensive area of farmland at Ashley Point across from Mhoon Landing. The camp at Midway, Arkansas is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 29.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 14.6 feet Thursday, April 07. - Action stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
